From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin ēvapōrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [ə.βə.puˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [ə.və.poˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [e.va.poˈɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

evaporar (first-person singular present evaporo, first-person singular preterite evaporí, past participle evaporat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /o/

  1. to evaporate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of evaporar (first conjugation)
infinitive evaporar
gerund evaporant
past participle masculine feminine
singular evaporat evaporada
plural evaporats evaporades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present evaporo evapores evapora evaporem evaporeu evaporen
imperfect evaporava evaporaves evaporava evaporàvem evaporàveu evaporaven
future evaporaré evaporaràs evaporarà evaporarem evaporareu evaporaran
preterite evaporí evaporares evaporà evaporàrem evaporàreu evaporaren
conditional evaporaria evaporaries evaporaria evaporaríem evaporaríeu evaporarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present evapori evaporis evapori evaporem evaporeu evaporin
imperfect evaporés evaporessis evaporés evaporéssim evaporéssiu evaporessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — evapora evapori evaporem evaporeu evaporin
negative (no) — no evaporis no evapori no evaporem no evaporeu no evaporin

Related terms

[edit]
  • evaporació

Further reading

[edit]
  • “evaporar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “evaporar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “evaporar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “evaporar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin ēvapōrō.

Verb

[edit]

evaporar

  1. to evaporate

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin ēvapōrāre (“to evaporate”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /e.va.poˈɾa(ʁ)/ [e.va.poˈɾa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /e.va.poˈɾa(ʁ)/ [e.va.poˈɾa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /e.va.poˈɾa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /e.va.poˈɾa(ʁ)/ [e.va.poˈɾa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /e.va.poˈɾa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.vɐ.puˈɾaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.vɐ.puˈɾaɾ/
    • (Northern Portugal) IPA(key): /i.bɐ.puˈɾaɾ/ [i.βɐ.puˈɾaɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /i.vɐ.puˈɾa.ɾi/

  • Audio (Brazil (Caipira)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: e‧va‧po‧rar

Verb

[edit]

evaporar (first-person singular present evaporo, first-person singular preterite evaporei, past participle evaporado)

  1. (chemistry) to evaporate
    A água evapora à temperatura de 100ºC ― Water evaporates at the temperature of 100ºC
  2. (figuratively) to disappear, to vanish
    Synonyms: desaparecer, sumir
    O menino evaporou! ― The boy vanished!

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of evaporar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

(tu) 		Third-person

Pluperfect evaporara evaporaras evaporara evaporáramos evaporáreis evaporaram

Conditional evaporaria evaporarias evaporaria evaporaríamos evaporaríeis evaporariam
Subjunctive
Present evapore evapores evapore evaporemos evaporeis evaporem
Imperfect evaporasse evaporasses evaporasse evaporássemos evaporásseis evaporassem
Future evaporar evaporares evaporar evaporarmos evaporardes evaporarem
Imperative
Affirmative evapora evapore evaporemos evaporai evaporem
Negative (não) não evapores não evapore não evaporemos não evaporeis não evaporem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • evaporação

Further reading

[edit]
  • “evaporar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin ēvapōrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ebapoˈɾaɾ/ [e.β̞a.poˈɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: e‧va‧po‧rar

Verb

[edit]

evaporar (first-person singular present evaporo, first-person singular preterite evaporé, past participle evaporado)

  1. (transitive or reflexive) to evaporate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of evaporar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)

gerund evaporando
past participle masculine feminine
singular evaporado evaporada
plural evaporados evaporadas
